remarks: We can always find values matching ` x ` and ` y ` , as long as they are represented by distinct variables.  This theorem merges two ~ ax6e instances ` E. z z = x ` and ` E. w w = y ` into a common expression. Alan Sare contributed a variant of this theorem with distinct variable conditions before, see ~ax6e2nd .  (Contributed by Wolf Lammen, 27-Sep-2018.)
statement: 2ax6elem $p |- ( -. A. w w = z -> E. z E. w ( z = x /\ w = y ) ) $.
